title: Śrī Guru Ārati-stuti
author: by Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj

translation: All glory to you, ‘Guru Maharaj,’<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Of sannyāsī kings, the Emperor:<br class="SongVerse__break" />The glorious Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Dev-Goswami Śrīdhar.

Extending in this world your<br class="SongVerse__break" />    Pastimes as saviour of the fallen,<br class="SongVerse__break" />You delivered all the suffering souls,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    including the most forsaken.

Beholding your holy form<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of concentrated mercy<br class="SongVerse__break" />The fortunate souls fall in a swoon<br class="SongVerse__break" />    of divine love’s ecstasy.

Your lofty form full of divine emotion<br class="SongVerse__break" />    is nectar for our eyes;<br class="SongVerse__break" />With divine knowledge and shining eyes,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    your effulgence fills the skies.

A golden Sun resplendent,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    in robes of saffron dressed;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Adorned with tilak, Tulasī beads,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    and with sandal fragrance blessed.

The matchless beauty of your holy form,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    dazzling in its brightness;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Your benevolence of most noble heart,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    in the moonglow of love’s sweetness.

Inconceivable genius, affection,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    gravity, magnanimity —<br class="SongVerse__break" />A thunderbolt crushing mundane knowledge,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    the reservoir bestowing divinity.

In the Golden Lord’s Saṅkīrtan Dance,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    you revel ecstatically;<br class="SongVerse__break" />“Dayāl Nitāi, Dayāl Nitāi!”<br class="SongVerse__break" />    you ever call so lovingly.

Eternally present in Nabadwīp Dhām<br class="SongVerse__break" />    with your associates, by your sweet will,<br class="SongVerse__break" />You enjoy your holy Pastimes<br class="SongVerse__break" />    on hidden Govardhan Hill.

You’re the fit recipient of your dignity
    In the Gauḍīya Āchārya assembly,
The jewel of the Gauḍīya-siddhānta
    adorning your chest so nobly.

You’re the living message of Śrī Gaura,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    you’re the mine of perfect conclusions;<br class="SongVerse__break" />You revealed the Gāyatrī’s inner purport:<br class="SongVerse__break" />    the gem fulfilling all aspirations.

When you speak, one subject alone<br class="SongVerse__break" />    is revealed in ever-new light;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Proper adjustment, and harmony —<br class="SongVerse__break" />    All these are your spiritual might.

All your dear Godbrothers<br class="SongVerse__break" />    declare unanimously<br class="SongVerse__break" />They see within your Holiness<br class="SongVerse__break" />    the line of Rūpa-Saraswatī.

Seeing you take the Holy Name,<br class="SongVerse__break" />    with Tulasī beads in hand,<br class="SongVerse__break" />Awakens the thought of Saraswatī Ṭhākur<br class="SongVerse__break" />    in everybody’s mind.

Your feet, cooling like ten million moons —<br class="SongVerse__break" />    In their service all faith do I place;<br class="SongVerse__break" />The nectar of Rādhā-Govinda’s Pastimes<br class="SongVerse__break" />    one day we may drink, by your grace.

O personification of perfect conclusions
    inconceivably one, yet different!
I sing this prayer at your ārati,
    with joy — your humble servant.
